DOC.brief_summary: This pilot study design ass relationship iFR pullback distribution coronary atheroma/stenoses assess Quantitative Coronary Angiography ( QCA ) post angiographically successful PCI .
DOC.brief_title: Physiologic Assessment Coronary Stenosis Following PCI
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subject must > 18 year old 2 . Subjects present stable angina , silent ischemia nonSTelevation ACS ( unstable angina biomarker positive ) 3 . Single vessel CAD least 2 separate lesion ( ≥10 mm apart ) ≥40 % stenosis single long lesion ≥20mm OR multivessel CAD , define least 2 vessel ≥40 % stenosis 4 . PrePCI iFR perform vessel intend PCI 5 . PrePCI iFR < 0.90 least 1 stenosis 6 . Subjects able willing comply schedule visit test provide informed consent . 1 . Pregnant plan become pregnant duration study 2 . Acute STEMI within past 7 day 3 . Cardiogenic shock ( sustain ( > 10 min ) systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg absence inotropic support presence intraaortic balloon pump ) . 4 . Ionotropic temporary pacing requirement 5 . Sustained ventricular arrhythmia 6 . Prior CABG 7 . Known ejection fraction ≤30 % 8 . Chronic Total Occlusion ( CTO ) 9 . Known severe mitral aortic stenosis . 10 . Any known medical comorbidity result life expectancy < 12 month . 11 . Participation investigational study yet reach primary endpoint . 12 . Known severe renal insufficiency ( eGFR < 30 ml/min/1.72 m2 ) . 13 . TIMI flow < 3 baseline 14 . Intracoronary thrombus baseline angiography
